    • getNodes

      public ArrayList<Node> getNodes()

      public ArrayList<Edge> getEdges()

      public String getLabel()

    • setLabel

      public void setLabel(String label)

    • addNode

      public boolean addNode(Node n)
      Adds a node to the graph. Does not add the node if it already exists in the graph.
      Parameters:
      n - the node to add.
      Returns:
      success or failure.

    • addEdge

      public boolean addEdge(Edge e)
      Adds an edge to the graph. Does not add the edge if it is already in the graph, or one of the connecting nodes is not.
      Parameters:
      e - the edge to add.
      Returns:
      success or failure.

    • countNodeNodeOcclusion

      public int countNodeNodeOcclusion(float threshold)
      Method to count the occlusion between pairs of nodes in the graph
      Parameters:
      threshold - gives the limit to give a positive occlusion result for any two node centres
      Returns:
      the number of pairs of nodes occluded

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Removes the nodes and edges from the graph, leaving an empty graph. This is a destructive clear as nodes are removed from the graph, so loosing their edge connections.

    • removeEdge

      public boolean removeEdge(Edge removeEdge)
      Removes the edge from the graph. Accounts for redundant data connecting nodes. Do not try and manipulate the edge again, it is left without connecting nodes.
      Parameters:
      the - Edge to remove.
      Returns:
      the success of the operation, failure is due to edge not being in the graph.

    • removeNode

      public boolean removeNode(Node removeNode)
      Removes the node from the graph and deletes any connecting edges. Accounts for redundant data connecting nodes.
      Parameters:
      removeNode - The Node to remove.
      Returns:
      the success of the operation, failure is due to node not being in the graph.

    • removeNodes

      public void removeNodes(Collection<Node> c)
      Removes the given node collection. Does nothing if the elements in the collection are not nodes in the graph.
      Parameters:
      c - The nodes to remove.

    • removeEdges

      public void removeEdges(Collection<Edge> c)
      Removes the given edge collection. Does nothing if the elements in the collection are not edges in the graph.
      Parameters:
      c - The edges to remove.

    • randomizeNodePoints

      public void randomizeNodePoints(Point topleft, int width, int height)
      Randomizes the graph node locations to be within the rectangle defined by the parameters.
      Parameters:
      topleft - corner of the rectangle.
      width - width of the rectangle.
      height - height of the rectangle.

    • addAdjacencyNode

      public Node addAdjacencyNode(String nodeLabel)
      Either returns an existing node with the label, or if there is none creates a node with the label and adds it to the graph. If there are multiple nodes with the label, the first in the list is returned.
      Parameters:
      nodeLabel - The node label.
      Returns:
      the found or created node, or null if there is more than one node with the label.

    • addAdjacencyEdge

      public Edge addAdjacencyEdge(String fromLabel, String toLabel)
      Creates an unlabelled edge between the nodes with the given labels. If there are multiple nodes with the label, the first in the node list is used. If there are no nodes with the label, a new node is created.
      Parameters:
      fromLabel - The label of the destination node.
      toLabel - The label of the source node.
      edgeLabel - The label of the edge.
      Returns:
      the created edge, or null if was not created.

    • loadAdjacencyFile

      public boolean loadAdjacencyFile(String fileName)
      This loads the given adjacency list graph file into the graph, deleting any current nodes and edges. The file is in the form of a simple adjacency list, each line of the file is an edge, with nodes separated by the ADJACENCYSEPARATOR character. Any empty line or line with more than one colon is ignored. Nodes are assumed to have unique labels for the purpose of this loader. may appear in each line. Any non empty line without a colon is considered to be a node with no connecting edges.
      Parameters:
      fileName - the file name to save to.
      Returns:
      true if successful, false if there was a formatting problem.
